title: Belief Systems Project
descriptions:
Title: The Belief Systems Project: Elucidating the Structure and Dynamics of Interconnecting Attitudes and Values

Abstract:

The Belief Systems Project aims to revolutionize our understanding of democratic politics, extremism, and political decision-making by developing a comprehensive framework for analyzing the complex systems of interconnecting attitudes and values that underpin individuals' beliefs. Current conceptualizations of belief systems are flawed, neglecting the interrelationships between beliefs and failing to capture their dynamic nature. This project addresses these limitations by employing network analyses to map the structure of systems of attitudes and values, answer questions about central concepts and clustering, and model within-person belief systems and variations.

Through a multi-method approach, incorporating survey data, longitudinal panel studies, intensive longitudinal designs, experiments, and text analyses, this project will investigate the structure of political belief systems over time, between countries, and within individuals. By doing so, it will provide novel insights into the dynamics of belief systems, including how they change in response to external and internal pressures. The proposed research has significant implications for our understanding of democratic politics, extremism, and political decision-making, and will contribute to the development of more effective strategies for promoting democratic values and mitigating the spread of extremist ideologies.
